content.raw: Bumping for visibility. Any updates on this?
content.html: Bumping for visibility. Any updates on this?

content.raw: Bump to blocker since it's needed for the competition.
content.html: Bump to blocker since it's needed for the competition.

content.raw:
I don't think the `hand_desired_configuration` interface will be supported. We are still documenting the grasping control, but an early example can be viewed in the following repository:

* https://github.com/scpeters/val_grasping

There are currently some quirks with grasping that will be fixed by the following pull request:

* https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/val_description/merge_requests/16
content.html:
I don't think the hand_desired_configuration interface will be supported. We are still documenting the grasping control, but an early example can be viewed in the following repository:

  • https://github.com/scpeters/val_grasping

There are currently some quirks with grasping that will be fixed by the following pull request:

  • https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/val_description/merge_requests/16

content.raw: Note, I still need to figure out how to publish the joint_states for the fingers in that example package.
content.html: Note, I still need to figure out how to publish the joint_states for the fingers in that example package.

content.raw: Thanks for the update. Do you have an ETA for when this will all be ready to go? We've already demonstrated our walking prowess during qualification, and the other tasks available in the world file right now all require grasping, so this is a major blocker for development.
content.html: Thanks for the update. Do you have an ETA for when this will all be ready to go? We've already demonstrated our walking prowess during qualification, and the other tasks available in the world file right now all require grasping, so this is a major blocker for development.

content.raw: Have you tried the example package that I posted? I'll try to get the joint_states working today. You may be able to get started now with what is there.
content.html: Have you tried the example package that I posted? I'll try to get the joint_states working today. You may be able to get started now with what is there.

content.raw: I added joint state publishing in https://github.com/scpeters/val_grasping/commit/300150b5c3b7c891fe6d0ca361f2a485945a2c75
content.html: I added joint state publishing in https://github.com/scpeters/val_grasping/commit/300150b5c3b7c891fe6d0ca361f2a485945a2c75

content.raw: Sorry, you'll need to `apt-get install ros-indigo-position-controllers ros-indigo-joint-state-controller`
content.html: Sorry, you'll need to apt-get install ros-indigo-position-controllers ros-indigo-joint-state-controller

content.raw: and you'll have to restart the simulation after installing those packages so the controller manager will recognize them
content.html: and you'll have to restart the simulation after installing those packages so the controller manager will recognize them

content.raw:
1. Installed the two controllers
2. Ran catkin_make without errors
3. Simulation was not running so started a new one
4. Ran the controller launch command.
4. Ran the four example commands.
    1. The thumb rotation worked, i.e. first value in list.
    2.  No response from the other 4 values on either hand. 
5. Used rostopic echo to make sure the left command was sent properly. 

Tried restarting the simulation, launch and topic command multiple times. The thumb rotation can be controlled but nothing else.
content.html:
1. Installed the two controllers
  2. Ran catkin_make without errors
  3. Simulation was not running so started a new one
  4. Ran the controller launch command.
  5. Ran the four example commands.
    1. The thumb rotation worked, i.e. first value in list.
    2. No response from the other 4 values on either hand.
  6. Used rostopic echo to make sure the left command was sent properly.

Tried restarting the simulation, launch and topic command multiple times. The thumb rotation can be controlled but nothing else.

content.raw: I may have used the wrong sign in the example commands. I'll test it later this morning to be sure.
content.html: I may have used the wrong sign in the example commands. I'll test it later this morning to be sure.

content.raw:
I reversed the sign of the values and got movement. 

What are the ranges for the values? 

I took the left command and made it right command. The hand and arm twitched to the back of R5 and then came around to the front with the fingers moved. I assume that exceeded some value.

content.raw:
Yeah, sorry I had reversed the commands. The hand twitches due to numerical instability that will be fixed by https://gitlab.com/nasa-jsc-robotics/val_description/merge_requests/16

I've uploaded a urdf with the updated gains here:

* https://gist.github.com/scpeters/2cf636be6271cd94351c014138856180

content.raw: I have seen some delays when launch the hand controllers. It eventually resumes full speed, but I'm not sure why that delay occurs. I can sometimes avoid the delay if I start the hand controllers early in the simulation.
content.html: I have seen some delays when launch the hand controllers. It eventually resumes full speed, but I'm not sure why that delay occurs. I can sometimes avoid the delay if I start the hand controllers early in the simulation.

content.raw: works well, fingers and thumbs responding nicely.
content.html: works well, fingers and thumbs responding nicely.

content.raw: hand_desired_configuation still doesn't work.  Is that going to be incorporated, or should we plan to just use these new topics?
content.html: hand_desired_configuation still doesn't work. Is that going to be incorporated, or should we plan to just use these new topics?

content.raw: @scpeters We are about to spend a TON of time incorporating the val_grasping code into our algorithms.  Is there some assurance that this controller and these topics will be used in the final configuration and we will not have to go back to the IHMC topics?
content.html: @scpeters We are about to spend a TON of time incorporating the val_grasping code into our algorithms. Is there some assurance that this controller and these topics will be used in the final configuration and we will not have to go back to the IHMC topics?

content.raw: We have released an updated package with the `val_grasping` code included in srcsim, so it will start automatically. You will not have to go back to the IHMC topics. Please `sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade` to try it.
content.html: We have released an updated package with the val_grasping code included in srcsim, so it will start automatically. You will not have to go back to the IHMC topics. Please sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade to try it.

content.raw: That upgrade should also have all the urdf improvements from the pending val_description pull requests
content.html: That upgrade should also have all the urdf improvements from the pending val_description pull requests

content.raw:
The grasping is working, at least the fingers move. Haven't tried to do anything yet. 

There is no documentation on the API page. 

Do one of the joint output command accurately reflect these positions? They seem to report all the finger joints, not just the position from these topics. Is that correct? 

General question is which of the various joint commands are (1) going to be available and (2) are meaningful?
